ygData.subject: Re: Chant of Battle and Jonthan's Whistling Warsong
ygData.msgSnippet: For a few moments you still have a lasting effect from the previous song. If you juggle the songs as mentioned previously in the thread, you can effectively
ygData.messageBody:
For a few moments you still have a lasting effect from the previous song.
If you juggle the songs as mentioned previously in the thread, you can
effectively have 2 songs going, affecting your whole party, or yourself,
etc. etc.

----- Original Message -----
From: Michael Meadows <meadows@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 9:25 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Chant of Battle and Jonthan's Whistling Warsong


> From: "Michael Meadows" <meadows@...>
>
> Can someone please explain how to play two songs at once? Whenever I
switch
> songs the other one ends.
>
> Paralto of Povar
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: John Robertson [mailto:johnr@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 9:00 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Re: Chant of Battle and Jonthan's Whistling Warsong
> >
> >
> > From: "John Robertson" <johnr@...>
> >
> > The Anthem is much better, since it increases your attack speed. The
> > effect is subtle, but it is definately there, believe me. It also
> > stacks with Jonthan's Warsong, so your attack speed is VERY much sped
> > up, and your strength increases by a huge amount. I play these two
> > songs when soloing even now at level 17. (And even higher with my high
> > level bard in Beta).
> >
> > Jyzan
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
